intro: Corallocarpus glomeratus var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender coral tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant features compound leaves with small, opposite leaflets and produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and public spaces for its vibrant floral display.
